summary: Internal FBI email chain discussing coordination with SDNY regarding a press release about Prince Andrew's response to an MLAT request, and providing updates on the investigation into Ghislaine Maxwell, including planned indictment charges and surveillance efforts.

persons.name: Prince Andrew
persons.role: Subject of MLAT request and investigation
persons.context: His counsel is issuing a public statement in response to the MLAT request from SDNY; there have been conversations about interviewing him.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: SDNY plans to obtain a six-count indictment against her; charges include conspiracy to entice, enticement, conspiracy to transport minors, transportation, and perjury; surveillance and mail cover are being conducted.

persons.name: John
persons.context: Mentioned as someone from whom the email sender has not heard regarding SDNY's plans to speak with the USA.

persons.name: HeyM
persons.context: Appears to be an FBI agent or staff member copied on emails discussing investigation updates and coordination with SDNY.

connections.description: Both are subjects of investigation in the Epstein case; the email discusses MLAT requests for Prince Andrew and indictment plans for Maxwell.
HeyM is involved in FBI discussions regarding the MLAT request and investigation involving Prince Andrew.
HeyM is copied on emails detailing investigation updates, indictment plans, and surveillance efforts targeting Maxwell.

events.title: MLAT Response Coordination
events.description: Prince Andrew's counsel issues a public statement in response to an MLAT request; SDNY plans to issue a statement in response and has drafts being made.

events.title: Maxwell Indictment Planning
events.description: SDNY plans to obtain a six-count indictment against Ghislaine Maxwell once a grand jury is available; charges include conspiracy to entice, enticement, conspiracy to transport minors, transportation, and perjury.

events.title: Surveillance and Mail Cover
events.description: FBI has a mail cover on an address believed to be Maxwell's residence and renewed a Pen register for her phone; plans for physical surveillance are mentioned.

keyFacts: Prince Andrew's counsel was issuing a public statement in response to an MLAT request from SDNY, with SDNY planning a coordinated press release.
SDNY planned to indict Ghislaine Maxwell on six counts: conspiracy to entice, enticement, conspiracy to transport minors, transportation, and two counts of perjury.
Investigative measures against Maxwell included a mail cover on her suspected address, a renewed Pen register for her phone, and planned surveillance.
The email indicates ongoing coordination between the FBI and SDNY regarding the Epstein case investigations into both Prince Andrew and Ghislaine Maxwell.
